svg.text: Open source friendly on Linux. Commercial licensing for Windows deployments.

text.tspan: For individuals with less than $35,000 annual income
Full access to all features - no limitations
Perfect for learning, personal projects, and side hustles
For businesses with $35K - $250K annual revenue
Monthly or annual billing options available
Required for businesses above $250K annual revenue
Custom pricing based on team size and needs

g.text: Why Linux Gets the Free Tier

text.tspan: Linux is the home of open source. Developers building on Linux
are often contributing to the ecosystem that makes tools like
SpecMem possible. We want to support that community.
The free tier is not limited - you get everything. If you are
an individual developer under $35K income, go build something
awesome. When you succeed, the paid tiers are here.

g.text: Commercial licensing required - No free tier
In addition to instance pricing, applies to gross revenue

text.tspan: Each simultaneous installation running on a unique machine.
One developer using SpecMem on one laptop = 1 instance.
CI/CD pipelines may require additional instances.

g.text: Can I use Linux in a commercial product?

text.tspan: Yes! Once you exceed $35K personal income or $250K
business revenue, you move to the appropriate paid tier.
The free tier is for individuals, not companies.
Windows deployments typically indicate enterprise/commercial
use. Linux remains the primary platform for open source
development, which we want to support freely.
macOS is treated as Linux for licensing purposes.
Same free tier for individuals, same commercial tiers
for businesses. Unix-like = developer-friendly pricing.

svg.text: All prices in USD. See LICENSE.md for complete terms. Subject to change before official release.
